utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That was close.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: God, I love the smell of paintballs in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, still funny, Raj.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s no way we can get to the ridge. The Chemistry Department has us completely cut off.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But what about the creek bed?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The Pharmacology Department controls that, and they’re all hopped up on experimental steroids.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, that’s it then, we’re doomed.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think the time has come to acknowledge that we are paying the price for some of us failing to attend my Physics Department paintball strategy meeting.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I told you my mom has spider veins, I had to take her to the laser clinic.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I told you I wanted to see a doctor’s note.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We need a plan. How about Operation Hammer of the Gods?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I forget. Which one is Hammer of the Gods?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We hide behind the Dumpsters in the parking lot and ambush people when they come to pee.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No go. The Dumpsters are deep in Astronomy Department territory.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, that shouldn’t be a problem, Venus is up during the day. They’re probably just all staring at the sky.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, what we need now is a tactical retreat. Did you see the episode of Stargate where they found themselves on a planet with a culture based loosely on Earth’s Athens and Sparta? Not important. Leonard, Raj and I are going to burst out the door and run away, Howard will cover us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why don’t I run away and you cover me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because you chose your mother’s veins over victory. On three. One, two, three, go!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I had to take her! It’s almost bathing suit weather!

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Howard, I’m on your team.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, Leslie, thank God.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Where’s the rest of your squad?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ah, they left me here to die. What about yours?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Dead, all of them.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Don’t be. It was friendly fire. They just wouldn’t listen.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, we’re surrounded, so I guess there’s nothing for us to do but wait to be captured or killed.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Hmm, that’s the worst part, the waiting.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All the while knowing that there’s a paint pellet out there with your name on it.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Yeah, the big wet ball of death. Kind of makes you feel more alive, doesn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It kind of does.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: I say we make every moment count.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I agree. How exactly do we do that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard (voice)
utterance.content: Howard, why aren’t you covering us? We’re getting slaughtered out here!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: War is hell.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Did you guys see the new budget memo that went out this morning?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, more cutbacks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Unacceptable. It baffles me why they don’t simply let some of you go so that there’s money available for my research.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what baffles me, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Based on your academic record, any number of things, I would imagine.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Leslie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Howard, I got the approval for the rapid prototyper you wanted.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s great, Leslie. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: You scratch my back, I scratch yours. Rawr.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What was all that about?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, uh, no big deal. They gave Leslie control of some unrestricted grant money.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, but what’s with the back-scratching and the meow!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I believe the back-scratching metaphor generally describes a quid pro quo situation where one party provides goods or services to the second party in compensation for a similar action.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The mrow, that sounded to me like an African civet cat.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you done?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Despite what the name suggests, the civet cat is not a true cat. Now I’m done.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know what I’m thinking? I’m thinking Howard wasn’t making a back-scratching metaphor. I’m thinking there was some actual scratching involved.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What about it, Howard?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, I didn’t want to say anything ’cause I know you and Leslie have a little history.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t care about that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great, ’cause I’ve been dying to say something.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You and Leslie?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: In the paintball shed! Twice!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is that why you didn’t cover our escape and let us get cut down like animals?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My good man, dereliction of duty in the face of the enemy is a court-martial offense.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Court-martial, schmort-martial, Leslie Winkle is the fifth girl I’ve ever had sex with. I mean, for free.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And plus, you got a rapid prototyper. That’s an expensive piece of equipment, dude.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, one way to look at this is that I’m getting new equipment, and you’re not, and that’s unfair. But a better way to look at this is that I’m getting sex and you’re not, and that’s delightful.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: The whole thing froze. I don’t know what happened.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Calm down. We’ll figure it out.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How can I calm down? I’m gonna lose my whole shopping cart. That’s three hours of picking out shoes just shot to hell.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hello, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re in my spot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you planning on sitting here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I’m going to the comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Then what difference does it make?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What difference does it make?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is my spot. In an ever-changing world, it is a single point of consistency. If my life were expressed as a function on a four-dimensional Cartesian coordinate system, that spot at the moment I first sat on it would be zero-zero-zero-zero.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t sit in his spot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine. Happy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not unhappy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Boy, I love him, but he is one serious wackadoodle.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, that should do it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, thank you. You are a lifesaver.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s a lot of shoes you ordered.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, you know the sad thing is, it’s really not. Ooh, is this one of those paintball guns?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. You ought to come out with us sometime.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, thanks. I’m from Nebraska. When we shoot things, it’s because we want to eat them or make them leave our boyfriends alone.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Boy, your heart’s racing. I must’ve really gotten you going.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, it’s partly you, partly my transient idiopathic arrhythmia.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Sexy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Can I assume that you likewise found the experience…

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Satisfactory?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That wasn’t quite the word I was looking for, but sure, I’ll do this pass-fail.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Hey, are you enjoying that prototyper I got you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, it’s great. Everybody in the Engineering Department is eating their hearts out.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Isn’t it nice when your good fortune makes others miserable?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, most people don’t get that.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Howard, I’m home!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, great.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Book club was cancelled! That thing on Phyllis’s neck opened up again!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m busy, Ma!

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Too busy to help your mother with her zipper?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t come in, Ma!

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: He’s got company!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, there’s the arrhythmia.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Is she Jewish?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Are you Jewish?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Okay, then you kids have fun! Use protection!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You think he’ll notice?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s a chance.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, what are we gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We? No, no, no, you had your chance to be we for, like, a year and a half now. Right now, you are you, and you are screwed.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why do we have to tell him I did it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, we’re not gonna tell him I did it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, okay, how about this? We tell him somebody broke in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just to shoot the couch with a paintball gun?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I buy it. All those people are on drugs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We could tell him they wanted the couch to stay away from their boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Well, what if we just flip it over? There. Looks fine, right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm, butt print. There’s no discernible butt print.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on. There, butt print.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s too small and too perfect.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Penny (as Sheldon enters)
utterance.content: Shh! Act normal.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon! How was the comic book store?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. The new issue of Flash is out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great, great. Did you walk the whole way? It’s a little chilly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Koothrappali picked me up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Isn’t that terrific? He is such a good friend. You know what the best thing about friends is?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They don’t talk incessantly for no particular reason.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, friends forgive the little things.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I gotta go home and wash my hair.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t you dare, missy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello, fastest man alive. Want to see me read your entire comic book? Want to see it again? Something’s wrong.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not sure. It doesn’t feel right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about. Oh, that. Penny did that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why don’t you just eat in your desk chair?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why don’t I just eat in my desk chair?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is my desk chair, that is where I work. I don’t eat in my desk chair and I don’t work in my spot. I work in my desk chair and eat in my spot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wackadoodle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, there’s kind of an obvious solution here. Get up. There. Problem solved. Nobody cares where you’re going to sit. You’re not crazy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, but the problem is not solved. If your head had been accidentally amputated, and we transplanted a dog’s head in its place, would that be “problem solved”?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If it were your head, it would be.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, I am really, really sorry, but it’s only for a week. Can’t you be a little bit flexible? Yeah, sorry. I didn’t really think that through.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You claim it’s going to be a week, but I have no faith in your dry cleaner.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you notice the sign on his counter? He’s not a full-time dry cleaner. He also makes keys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, for God’s sake, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Focus is important. Was Michael DeBakey a wedding planner in between heart transplants? Did Alexander Fleming moonlight as a hairdresser? “Thanks for discovering penicillin, now how about we try a bouffant?”

utterance.speaker: Howard (after his phone rings)
utterance.content: Ooh, looks like I’m gonna have sex tonight. Hey, baby…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: His right hand is calling him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it’s Leslie Winkle. It’s a long story.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll pick you up in ten minutes. Gentlemen, adieu.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought we were going to play Halo tonight.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What am I supposed to do, Leonard? There’s a woman out there anxious to have sex with me. You understand, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. Not at all.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nevertheless, I must depart. By the way, did I tell you? Leslie pulled some strings and got me on the research trip to Geneva to check out the CERN Supercollider.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not fair. You’re not even a physicist.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, there are two ways of looking at this…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Get out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: You’re improving.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you. It helps when I get to practice with a real woman.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Hey, listen. Saturday my sister’s getting married. I.. I want you to come with me. It’s black tie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, gee, I’d really rather not.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: When I go to weddings, it’s to scam on chunky bridesmaids. I don’t know what I would do with a date.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Oh, all right. I understand.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Hey, I’m really sorry about that Geneva trip.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What about it?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Oh, didn’t you hear? I had to reduce the number of people going, and you didn’t make the cut.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: When did that happen?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: About 12 seconds ago.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, hold on. Are you saying if I don’t go to the wedding, I can’t go to Geneva?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Actually, I’m trying not to say it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, I’m sorry, but that makes me a little uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Because it’s like you’re controlling me with new equipment and research trips.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Well, if I weren’t controlling you with new equipment and research trips, then I’d be uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: ‘Cause then we’d be in, like, a real relationship with feelings and all that crap.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, bottom line, I’m just a bought-and-paid-for sex toy.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: No. No, not at all. You’re also arm candy. So? What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Ma, you got to rent me a tux!

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Right now? What kind of sex are you having up there?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why are you crouching there?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is my spot. Where else am I supposed to crouch?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Texas?

utterance.speaker: Penny (arriving with cushion)
utterance.content: Here you go. Fresh from the cleaners, good as new.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? Great. Sheldon, look. Good as new.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: From that key maker, I highly doubt it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, Sheldon. Just give it a try.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: There, nice and comfy cosy. Zero, zero, zero.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s one more zero. You forgot the time parameter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sit on the damn couch.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What do you mean, nope? What’s wrong with it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nothing, it’s what’s wrong with him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s exactly the same…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, Penny, I think I know what to do. Sheldon, I have some bad news.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: More?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m afraid so. You know the cashew chicken I get you Monday nights?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. From Szechuan Palace.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Szechuan Palace closed two years ago.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What? Wh-Where did my cashew chicken come from?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Golden Dragon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. No, this isn’t right. Our food always comes in Szechuan Palace containers.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, well, before they went out of business, I bought 4,000 containers. I keep them in the trunk of my car.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But. Oh, this changes everything.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought that might take his mind off the cushion.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s real? What isn’t? How can I know?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You did make that up, right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, God, I wish I had.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, buddy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I still don’t like this cushion.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, first of all, Penny, thank you for coming.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks for the shoes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny is an amazing shot. I think we have a real chance to win this week.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s the plan?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Right, just one thing before we start.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What is it, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That was for my cushion.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, Penny was our only hope.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Leonard. But revenge is a dish best served cold.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Screw that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She can’t shoot me. She’s dead.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s right. You can’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, if we’re going to descend into anarchy

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, see you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Surrender, then Denny’s.
